etymologies: Middle English (in cruet (sense 2)): from Anglo-Norman French, diminutive of Old French crue ‘pot’, from Old Saxon krūka; related to crock

definitions: a small container for salt, pepper, oil, or vinegar for use at a dining table.
shortDefinitions: small container or set of containers for salt, pepper, oil, or vinegar for use at dining table

definitions: (in church use) a small container for the wine or water to be used in the celebration of the Eucharist.
shortDefinitions: (in church use) small container for wine or water
